action_title: Slow rotation of turbine blades at low wind speeds
key_messages:
Key Messages:

One study evaluated the effects of slowing the rotation of turbine blades at low wind speeds on bat populations. The study was in Canada.

COMMUNITY RESPONSE (0 STUDIES)
POPULATION RESPONSE (1 STUDY)

Survival (1 study): One replicated, randomized, controlled study in CanadaÂ found that bat fatalities were reduced when turbine blades were slowed at low wind speeds.

BEHAVIOUR (0 STUDIES)
